column4: when I freshly install ubuntu, is there anything I should run or update first?
I can't seem to find my Dell wireless n card
there should be a bunch of updates waiting for you off the bat
what does lspci say about that card (just one line)
bazhang, it says Broadcom Corporation BCM4328 802.11a/b/g/n (rev 03)
did you read the !broadcom link?
whats the issue
lightdm died after I selected update in update manager
now I can't boot past *staring lightdm display manager [fail]
what about in recovery mode
how do I get into recovery mode?
hold shift a t boot
try vlc and mplayer yet?
try mplayer or vlc yet? those are not totem
please wait.. I have to re-install vlc because the upgrade to 11.10 deleted them from my system
greenit - VLC works, but that doesn't help me - my remote does not work with VLC
what about mplayer
I tried sudo apt-get install mplayer but I can't find anyway to start it. there is no icon under applications
what about alt f2 mplayer to launch it
in the alt f2 window?
ok.. mplayer plays video
why not use mplayer then
I will have to now, but it is a pain to have to launch videos from the command line
sounds like a bug; file one and check launchpad for same
